title: Are they bots or new players?
body:
I was just wondering. whats up with those weird accounts on ARAM or Bots matches, i mean the accounts where it seems like some one has slammed their haind agaisnt their keyboard and then types a random word down. 
i had a bot game to day and i had 4 of these accounts in my game and they just ran down mid like 20 times. i just wanted to know if these accoutns are new players or bots. and if they are bots are they riot implimented.

thanks in advance 
Shadenfreude

replies.body:
See, what Riot needs to do, is identify bots, wait until they are sold @ lvl 30 or whatever (when the account email/password changes), and then ban them.
That way, the people buying bot leveled accounts suffer, and it kills the business of botting.
Banning a bot account while it's still a bot account does nothing. A drop in the bucket.

Would it be better if Riot detected a bot, only matchmake it with other bots to avoid ruining other players fun until lvl 30, and ban it after it plays one SR pvp game? And if there isn't enough bots to make up a game, Riot temporarily makes up 4 other bots on their side to play with them?

> [{quoted}](name=Buttsubushi,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=GZTRrGhq,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-02-26T16:20:10.012+0000)
>
> Would it be better if Riot detected a bot, only matchmake it with other bots to avoid ruining other players fun until lvl 30, and ban it after it plays one SR pvp game? And if there isn't enough bots to make up a game, Riot temporarily makes up 4 other bots on their side to play with them?

Sure.
Anything that stops legit players being matched with bots has to be an improvement.

They are likely bots. They are not ones that Riot put in games, they are ones that people run scripts to level and then they sell them once they hit level 30. 

[Riot know about the issue and are always working on tackling it, but its something easier said than done. ](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/78Nvd6pV-can-we-please-just-ip-ban-players-who-use-bot-programs-to-play-the-game?comment=0000000100000000)
When some scumbag is making a living out of scripting to level 30 they aren't exaclty going to go down without a fight. They likely to keep building on their skills and scripts so that the detection systems are always a few steps behind. That being said, a large number of bot accounts are banned before they hit 30 (or shortly after)
At least when they all run it down mid that you have [some chance to win](https://imgur.com/a/7LCmx). They pressure the map more than an oce bronze or silver player would.
i assumed they where scripted bots. but i originally assumed they where random bots used when the system cannot find anyone else queueing up at that time.
I believe they are bots. And I think they’re made by other people unless if rito is desperate to retain the number one most played game spot
